title: Tuise Lesson three - Installing and running Tuise
content:
**Tuise** needs a vsiual interface, in this post we'll be installing exactly that.

#### Preface
Being all fancy, like we are, the interface will be based on React. However, it is important to note that we don't use the [2pack-list repo](https://github.com/Cloudoki/2pack-list) from the [Mobile React Native](http://tuihackfridays.com/#article/10) for this. 
The reason is simple, React Native is wonderful for Android/iOS, but quite useless for a web browser.

_Make sure you installed the dependencies for your RPi as described in [Tuise Lesson two - How to install dependencies on my RPi]http://tuihackfridays.com/#article/13)._


## Step 1

In order to start with a good base, we'll use our own React Boilerplate.

### React/Redux Donderstarter
This boilerplate is designed to get you up and running with React/Router/Redux/Sagas workflow, backed up by webpack and unit testing with jest/enzyme.
The primary goal of this boilerplate is to provide a stable foundation upon which to build modern web applications.

#### Option a: from scratch
For reference, these are the steps we took to build the tuise interface, feel free to experiment with this process yourself. For the below process to work, first [create a new repo](https://help.github.com/articles/creating-a-new-repository/) in Github.
However, skip this step if you only want to the end result.

```git clone --bare https://github.com/Cloudoki/react-redux-donderstarter.git boilerplate```

```cd boilerplate```

```git push --mirror https://github.com/TUIHackfridays/tuise-poc.git```



#### Option b: clone _(choose this one)_
Of course, it has limited use to all work on different repositories, that's why you can simply collect the one we've pre-built:

``` cd ~/ ``` (or your preferred working directory)

```git clone https://github.com/TUIHackfridays/tuise-poc.git tuise-poc```

```cd tuise-poc```

```npm install```

```npm run dev```

Hot reloading is enabled by default for both **JavaScript** and **SCSS** files.

You'll see that we've added some entries to the `tuise-poc` reository.


We're currently actively building the repo for **Step 1**, hold on.
